short_instructions.https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20:
Play with these blocks to see what they make the bird do! 

Get the bird to the pig to complete the level.
_"A bug! Fix the code to get me to the pig."_
"Fix the code to get me to the pig!"
Add 2 blocks to get the bird to the pig.
Now try this puzzle from the start!
Move one way, then another to get the bird to the pig!
Figure out what is missing and then add blocks to get the bird to the pig!
Your turn!  What do you need to do to get the bird to the pig?
Challenge: Move around the TNT to get the bird to the pig.
Fix the bugs to get the bird to the pig.
It's all you!  Get the bird to the pig.
Now get that pig any way you can!
Can you find a path before you run out of blocks?
Debug this level. These are the right blocks, but they're in the wrong order!
"Go get the scrap metal, BB-8!"
Get all the metal.
Get all the scrap metal
Get all the scrap metal
Get the scrap metal
Get all the scrap metal
Go get it!
**Challenge:** Help BB-8 gather the glowing scrap metal
Help BB-8 gather the glowing scrap metal
Help BB-8 gather the glowing scrap metal
Help BB-8 gather the glowing scrap metal
This is Laurel the Adventurer!  Can you move her around and get treasure?
Get all four piles to pass this level.
How can Laurel get all five piles of treasure using only one `E -->` block?
Fix Laurel's path to get all of this treasure!
Add to the code from the last puzzle to get all of the treasure.
Figure out the code to help Laurel get all of the treasure!
Write the code to get all of this treasure.
**Challenge:** The treasure goes all the way down these stairs!  Write the code to help Laurel get it all.
_"Help me get the treasure from this deep valley."_
Help Laurel get all of the treasure from this cave.
Eureka!  Get as much treasure as you can!
This time you have limited blocks. Get all of the treasure!
Let's get the treasure! Help me across each row then come back to start the next row. Can you find a pattern?
This is a new type of puzzle called "Artist". Play with the level and draw something fun.
The Artist is trying to draw a line **6** times, but can't get it right.  Can you help?
Help the artist draw a line 7 times to make a garden wall.
Now we need to get the soil ready to plant. Find the bugs in the code and help the artist prepare the ground.
Time to fix the stairs!  Repeat this pattern **5** times so the artist can reach the top of the bushes.
Climb the vine and see where it goes?
**Challenge:**  It's a hidden garden! Let's walk around.
Time to head home. Can you fix this ladder using only one block to help the artist get down?
Let's take the short way home, over the pond. Can you help the artist stay on the stones?
Use what you have learned to draw a picture of what you think the artist saw when he got home.
"It's time to toss the dice! Can you help me draw these?"
Draw as many X's as you can. Can you get 3 in a row?
Need a better playlab/events combo
See if you can figure out what each block does.
Have Daisy the Dragon say something when you click "Run".
Use an event to make Daisy the Dragon switch to a random mood when you click on her.
Knight time!  Add an event so that the knight moves toward the dragon when the left arrow is clicked.
Now add an event so that the knight runs away from the dragon when you press the right arrow.

Help your knight get all of the flags!

To do this, you'll need to add events to help the knight move up, down, left, and right.
Make this game fun by setting the knight to vanish when he runs into the dragon on his way to get the flags!  Play a sound when they collide to make it feel more real.
Use your imagination. What can you do to make this game more fun?
Make the animals move down when you press â–¼.
Make the animals disappear when you click on them.

long_instructions.https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20: _"Fix the code to get me to the pig!"_
**Challenge:** Move around the TNT to get the bird to the pig.
You only have four of each move block. Can you find a path before you run out of blocks?

[Rey][0]_"Go get the scrap metal, BB-8!"_

Watch out for walls and crates. Scrap metal looks like this: [picture of scrap metal][1]
[][0] _"Get all the metal."_
[][0] _"Keep going, BB-8!"_
[][0] _"Can you get it all?"_
[][0] _"You can do it!"_
[][0] _"Go get it!"_

[][0] _"Keep it up, BB-8."_

**Challenge**: Gather all the scrap metal.
[][0] _"You can do it!"_
[][0] _"Can you get it all?"_
[][0] _"Keep going!"_

**Free Play:** This is Laurel the Adventurer! Move her around and get as much treasure as you can.

Drag blocks into the workspace and try to figure out how to get treasure.  Get at least one item to pass this level.

Move Laurel to the treasure, then use the<xml><block type="collector_collect"/></xml>block to pick it up.

Get all four piles to pass this level.
How can Laurel get all five piles of treasure using only one <xml><block type="maze_moveEast"/></xml> block?
Behind the bushes there is a beautiful vine full of flowers.  Can you climb the vine and see where it goes?
**Challenge:**  It's a hidden garden! Let's walk around.

Use what you have learned to draw a picture of what you think the artist saw when he got home.

* * *

### Ideas

[][0]
[][1]
[][2]
[][3]
_"It's time to toss the dice! Can you help me draw these?"_
Draw as many X's as you can. Can you get 3 in a row?

This game is called "Play Lab".  

See if you can figure out what each block does.
Use an event to make Daisy the Dragon switch to a random [][0] mood when you click on her.

Knight time!  

Add an event so that the knight moves toward the dragon when the left arrow is clicked.

Help your knight get all of the flags!

To do this, you'll need to add events to help the knight move up, down, left, and right.

Make this game fun by setting the knight to vanish when he runs into the dragon on his way to get the flags! 

Play a sound when they collide to make it feel more real.

Visit all of the goals, then run into the dragon to pass the level.

It's time for the Great Animal Race! Make the animals move down when you press `â–¼`. 

Who will run the fastest?

Let's make the animals disappear when you click on them.
Try playing with the dog now, then help the other animals join in the fun. You can also add sounds and score points to create a game of Animal Tag!

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq1_a: Connect blocks to the <xml><block type="when_run"/></xml> block to make the bird move!
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq1_b: Drag three of these <xml><block type="maze_moveSouth"/></xml> arrows out and connect them to the <xml><block type="when_run"/></xml> block to get your bird to the pig.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq2_a: This program is missing one block. Can you figure out which one?
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq2_b: Try running the code you are given to see what the bird needs to do next.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq3_a: One of the blocks is moving the bird in the wrong direction. Can you figure out which one and replace it with the correct block?
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq3_b: Try using the step button to find where the program goes wrong. Is it the first step? The second?
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq3_c: The <xml><block type="maze_moveWest"/></xml> block doesn't seem to be moving the bird in the right direction.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq4_a: Try adding one instruction at a time until you get to the pig.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq4_b: You will want to use the <xml><block type="maze_moveEast"/></xml> block to solve this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq5_a: If you get stuck, try drawing out the path on paper.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq5_b: There are 2 ways to solve this puzzle!
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq5_c: Not sure how to get to the pig?  Try this path.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq6_a: Your final code should have three movement blocks.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq6_b: If you get stuck, try solving the puzzle in two parts, one sideways and one up-and-down.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq5_c: There are two ways to solve this puzzle.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq5_d: Not sure how to get to the pig? Try this path!

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq7_a: Add 1 block to move the bird to the pig.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq7_b: Try running the code that's given to you and see where you end up.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq7_c: Can't get to the pig?  Try this path!

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq8_a: Try adding one block at a time until you solve the puzzle.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq8_b: There are two ways to solve this puzzle!
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq8_c: Don't know which way to go? Try this path!

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq9_a: Try writing down all of the steps on a piece of paper first.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq9_b: Build your program a block at a time and test as you build.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq9_c: There are two ways to solve this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq10_a: Try writing down the steps on a piece of paper first.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq10_b: You will need to move in two different directions to reach the pig.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq11_a: Try writing down the steps on a piece of paper first.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq11_b: Solve the puzzle in two parts: one before the corner and one after the corner.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq_challenge1_a: The shortest path might not work this time.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq_challenge1_b: Try using the <xml><block type="maze_moveWest"/></xml> block to start.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq_challenge2_a: You do not need to add or remove blocks to solve this puzzle.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq_challenge2_b: Rearrange the blocks and take the staircase pattern path.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog1_a: Try adding blocks one at a time, then click "Run" to see what happens.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog1_b:
You will want to move East to solve this puzzle. How far do you need to move?

<xml><block type="studio_moveEast"/></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog2_a: Split this problem into two parts. Get one one pile of scrap metal, then figure out how to get to the other one.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog3_a: You will need to move 3 ways to solve this puzzle.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog3_b: Build one piece of code at a time. Run it to figure out where to go from there.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog4_a: Build one piece of code at a time. Run it to figure out where to go from there.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog4_b:
Try using the `repeat` block for shorter code.

<xml>  <block type="controls_repeat_simplified">
    <title name="TIMES">3</title>
  </block>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog5_a: Doesn't this pattern look a little like the last puzzle?
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog5_b: BB-8 will grab the scrap metal as he rolls over it.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog5_c: Trace this pattern with your finger. Count the pieces of metal as you move.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog5_da:
Look what happens if you use the same solution as the stair-step puzzle:

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog6_a: This pattern is just a stair step with two moves per direction!
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog6_b:
Try using the `repeat` block for shorter code.

<xml>  <block type="controls_repeat_simplified">
    <title name="TIMES">3</title>
  </block>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog7_a: Doesn't this pattern look a little like the last puzzle?
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog7_b: BB-8 will grab the scrap metal as he rolls over it.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog7_c: Try drawing the large stair step pattern over this puzzle. Does it cover all of the scrap metal?

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog8_a: It is okay to go back over a set of spaces where you have already traveled.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog8_b:
Try using the `repeat` block to see what happens to the code that you put inside.

<xml>
  <block type="controls_repeat_simplified">
    <title name="TIMES">3</title>
  </block>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog9_a: Don't be afraid to make a mistake! Run the code to see what happens, even if you haven't solved the puzzle yet.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog9_b: There are many ways to solve this puzzle.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_starWars_prog9_c: Could a `repeat` loop help out here?

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops1_a: The <xml><block type="collector_collect_simplified"/></xml> block can be used to pick up treasure when you are standing on top of it.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops2_a: You'll have to move before you can collect any treasure.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops2_b: When you have reached a spot with treasure, use the <xml><block type="collector_collect"/></xml> block to pick it up.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_prog3_a: Try using a <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">5</title></block></xml> block to collect your treasure.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_prog3_b: Remember you can put more than one block inside a repeat loop.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops4_a: Try using the step button to figure out where things go wrong.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops4_b: To change how far Laurel goes, change the number of times that the loop runs.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops4_c: Laurel needs to walk down and collect the treasure after she finishes the `repeat` loop!

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops5_a: Use more than one loop to get the job done.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops5_b: Try running the code a couple of times to see what happens.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops6_a: Can't figure out where things start going wrong? Use the "Step" button to run through your program one block at a time.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops6_b: You can change the number of times the repeat loop runs by clicking on the "3" and choosing a different number.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops6_c: You will want to use 3 `repeat` loops to solve this puzzle.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops6_d: If you're confused, try breaking this puzzle into 3 pieces.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops7_a: If you are having a hard time with the puzzle, try drawing it on paper to help you figure it out.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops7_b: You will need 3 repeat loops to solve this puzzle, and don't forget the extra treasure at the end!

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops8_challenge_a: If you can't figure out where to put the repeat loops, write out the code step-by-step and look for a pattern.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops9_a: Does this seem too hard?  Break it up into 3 little problems to make it feel easier.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops9_b: You will need 3 repeat loops, one after the other, for this solution.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops10_a: If you can't figure out where to put the `repeat` loops, write out the code step-by-step and look for a pattern.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops10_b: Try writing the moves down on a piece of paper and looking for a pattern.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops_challenge1_b:
Start by looping the following commands:

<xml>
  <block type="maze_moveSouth">
    <next>
    <block type="collector_collect"></block>
    </next>
    </block>
</xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops_challenge1_c:
Move East twice between each path.

<xml>
  <block type="maze_moveEast"><next>
  <block type="maze_moveEast"></block></next></block>
  </xml>

You can do this with only 14 blocks. Click for one more hint to see a solution.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops_challenge1_d:
Try this!

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="controls_repeat_simplified">
        <title name="TIMES">5</title>
        <statement name="DO">
          <block type="maze_moveSouth">
            <next>
              <block type="collector_collect"/>
            </next>
          </block>
        </statement>
        <next>
          <block type="maze_moveEast">
            <next>
              <block type="maze_moveEast">
                <next>
                  <block type="controls_repeat_simplified">
                    <title name="TIMES">5</title>
                    <statement name="DO">
                      <block type="collector_collect">
                        <next>
                          <block type="maze_moveNorth"/>
                        </next>
                      </block>
                    </statement>
                    <next>
                      <block type="maze_moveEast">
                        <next>
                          <block type="maze_moveEast">
                            <next>
                              <block type="controls_repeat_simplified">
                                <title name="TIMES">5</title>
                                <statement name="DO">
                                  <block type="maze_moveSouth">
                                    <next>
                                      <block type="collector_collect"/>
                                    </next>
                                  </block>
                                </statement>
                              </block>
                            </next>
                          </block>
                        </next>
                      </block>
                    </next>
                  </block>
                </next>
              </block>
            </next>
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops_challenge2_a: If something goes wrong, don't be afraid to start over. Don't give up!
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops_challenge2_b:
If you repeat this pattern, Laurel won't hit the wall at the bottom of the cave!

<xml><block type="maze_moveEast">
            <next>
              <block type="collector_collect">
                <next>
                  <block type="maze_moveWest">
                    <next>
                      <block type="maze_moveWest">
                        <next>
                          <block type="maze_moveSouth"/>
                        </next>
                      </block>
                    </next>
                  </block>
                </next>
              </block>
            </next>
          </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops_challenge2_c: Try using a `repeat` block to collect the final pile of treasure!
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops_challenge2_d:
Try this solution:

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown">
        <title name="TIMES" config="3-10">4</title>
        <statement name="DO">
          <block type="maze_moveEast">
            <next>
              <block type="collector_collect">
                <next>
                  <block type="maze_moveWest">
                    <next>
                      <block type="maze_moveWest">
                        <next>
                          <block type="maze_moveSouth"/>
                        </next>
                      </block>
                    </next>
                  </block>
                </next>
              </block>
            </next>
          </block>
        </statement>
        <next>
          <block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown">
            <title name="TIMES" config="3-10">6</title>
            <statement name="DO">
              <block type="collector_collect"/>
            </statement>
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops2_a: If you want the loop to repeat more than 4 times, you can change the number at the top of the block.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops2_b: Try running the code first to see where the artist ends up.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops3_a: Remember to use a `repeat` loop for better code!
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops3_b: The artist will want to move South to draw this line.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops4_a: The jump block lets you move forward without drawing a line.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops4_b: You will need to add a block inside of the repeat loop to solve this puzzle.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops4_c: Don't forget to change the number of times the loop repeats.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops5_a: Drag out a `repeat` loop, then put the other blocks inside of it. How many times do you need to repeat?

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops6_b: Try writing the moves down on a piece of paper and look for a pattern.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops7_a: This challenge uses **4** loops, one right after another!
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops7_b:
Notice that every loop makes a stair pattern that goes a different direction.

[][0]
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops7_c:
The loops should do this:

-   Loop 1

    -   Right
    -   Down

-   Loop 2

    -   Right
    -   Up

-   Loop 3

    -   Left
    -   Up

-   Loop 4
    -   Left
    -   Down

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops8_a: How many times should you repeat the pattern to make the ladder?
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops8_b: Try running the code you're given to see what it does.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops9_a: Remember that jump blocks can be used to move without drawing a line.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops9_b: You will want to use the W block to solve this puzzle.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops9_c: Can't figure out where to put the loop? Try writing the code step-by-step and look for a pattern.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops_challenge1_a: Blocks like this: <xml>  <block type="simple_move_up_right"/></xml> will let your artist move at a slant!
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops_challenge1_b: When you finish one of the dice, `jump` to the next!
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops_challenge1_c: You will need to `move` or `jump` over some of the same lines twice.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops_challenge2_a: The code to draw an X is already given to you. All you need to do is repeat the X and `jump` to the next spot.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops_challenge2_b: You can use `jump` blocks to move to other spaces without drawing.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events2_a:
This is the block to have Daisy say something:

<xml>
  <block type="studio_saySpriteChoices">
    <title name="SPRITE">0</title>
    <title name="VALUE">Hi there.</title>
  </block>
  </xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events3_a:
This is the block you should use to add the event:

<xml>
<block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">0</title>
  </block>
  </xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events3_b:
This is the block you need to switch Daisy's mood:

<xml>
<block type="studio_setSpriteEmotion">
    <title name="SPRITE">0</title>
    <title name="VALUE">random</title>
  </block>
  </xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events4_a:
This is the event that controls the left arrow:

<xml>
  <block type="studio_whenArrow">
    <title name="VALUE">left</title>
  </block>
  </xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events4_b:
This is the block that makes the knight move left.

<xml>
<block type="studio_move">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
    <title name="DIR">8</title>
  </block>
  </xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events5_a:
This is the event block that controls the right arrow: 

<xml>
  <block type="studio_whenArrow">
    <title name="VALUE">right</title>
  </block>
  </xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events5_b:
This is the block that makes the knight run away. 

<xml>
<block type="studio_move">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
    <title name="DIR">2</title>
  </block>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events6_a:
You will need these event blocks:

<xml>
  <block type="studio_whenArrow" id="callMe">
    <title name="VALUE">up</title>
  </block>
  <block type="studio_whenArrow" id="callMe">
    <title name="VALUE">down</title>
  </block>
  </xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events6_b:
Use the drop down arrows on the green `when ___ arrow pressed` event blocks to choose different directions.

[][0]
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events6_c: Get to all of the flags to pass!

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events7_a:
This is the event block that you will need:

<xml>
<block type="studio_whenSpriteCollided">
    <title name="SPRITE1">0</title>
    <title name="SPRITE2">1</title>
  </block>
</xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events7_b:
This is the block you need to play a sound.

<xml>
<block type="studio_playSound">
    <title name="SOUND">slap</title>
  </block>
</xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events7_c:
This is the block you need to make the knight vanish:

<xml>
<block type="studio_vanish">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
  </block>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events_challenge1_a:
Make the other animals move down when you press `â–¼`. 

<xml>
  <block type="studio_whenArrow" movable="false">
    <title name="VALUE">down</title>
  </block>
</xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events_challenge1_b:
Change the speed of the animals by using this block:

<xml>
  <block type="studio_setSpriteSpeed">
    <title name="SPRITE">0</title>
    <title name="VALUE">Studio.SpriteSpeed.NORMAL</title>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events_challenge1_c:
What will the everyone say when the race is over? Make them talk with this event:

<xml>
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">2</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_saySpriteChoices">
        <title name="SPRITE">2</title>
        <title name="VALUE">Woo hoo!</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events_challenge2_a: Each animal in the game should disappear when clicked. It should also come back after a second or two!
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events_challenge2_b:
Use other event blocks to make the other animals disappear!

<xml>
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
  </block>
  </xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events_challenge2_c:
Use extra commands to play sounds or score points when you click the animals!

<xml>
  <block type="studio_playSound">
    <title name="SOUND">slap</title>
  </block>
  <block type="studio_changeScore"/></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events_challenge2_d:
Mix it up!

Make some animals give more points than others.
Use different sounds.
Change the animals' moods!

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq1: Click the lightbulb when you need a hint!

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq2_callout1: Use the step button to go step-by-step through the program. This will help you find the bug!

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_maze_seq3_1: The grey blocks are made of stone and can't be thrown away.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_collector_loops1_1: Do you see some new blocks in the toolbox?  Don't worry, we will show you how to use them later in the stage.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops3_1: There is only one of these blocks in the toolbox.  How will you use it?

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_artist_loops5_1: This number means that there are no more of this block left in the toolbox.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.courseB_playlab_events6_a: Use the green drop down arrow to change directions.
